text.__SUMMARY__: Penicillium montanense is an anamorph species of the genus of Penicillium which produces tannase.
text.Further reading:
Amram Eshel, Tom Beeckman (2013). Plant Roots: The Hidden Half, Fourth Edition (4 ed.). CRC Pres. ISBN 1439846499.
Edrada, R. A.; Heubes, M.; Brauers, G.; Wray, V.; Berg, A.; Gräfe, U.; Wohlfarth, M.; Mühlbacher, J. R.; Schaumann, K.; Sudarsono; Bringmann, G.; Proksch, P. (2002). "Online Analysis of Xestodecalactones A−C, Novel Bioactive Metabolites from the Fungus Penicillium cf.montanenseand Their Subsequent Isolation from the Sponge Xestospongiaexigua#". Journal of Natural Products. 65 (11): 1598. doi:10.1021/np020085c. PMID 12444683.
